author: iSazonov
body:
As we can see on https://coveralls.io/github/PowerShell/PowerShell some files reported with 0% coverage although the corresponding tests exist and should run successfully. Samples:

[NewTimeSpanCommand.cs](https://coveralls.io/builds/9534326/source?filename=C%2Fprojects%2Fpowershell-f975h%2Fsrc%2FMicrosoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility%2Fcommands%2Futility%2FNewTimeSpanCommand.cs)
[NewGuidCommand.cs](https://coveralls.io/builds/9534326/source?filename=C%2Fprojects%2Fpowershell-f975h%2Fsrc%2FMicrosoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility%2Fcommands%2Futility%2FNewGuidCommand.cs)
[NewWinEventCommand.cs](https://coveralls.io/builds/9534326/source?filename=C%2Fprojects%2Fpowershell-f975h%2Fsrc%2FMicrosoft.PowerShell.Commands.Diagnostics%2FNewWinEventCommand.cs)

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: I am working on a change which will generate logs for the tests that are executed. This will let us know if some tests are not executed or erroring out.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@adityapatwardhan @lzybkr 
I see the opposite that PSReadline files get into the coverage stats though should be removed because PSReadline live in a separate repo and we haven't PSReadline's tests in Powershell repo.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@adityapatwardhan
Please see link https://coveralls.io/builds/9893487/source?filename=C%2Fprojects%2Fpowershell-f975h%2Fsrc%2FMicrosoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility%2Fgen%2FSelectObjectStrings.cs
I got the error:
>Source Not Available
The file "C/projects/powershell-f975h/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/gen/SelectObjectStrings.cs" isn't available on github. Either it's been removed, or the repo root directory needs to be updated. 

The same result is for all files with `/gen/` in path.
Perhaps it makes sense to exclude them from statistics too.
(Although statistics can help identify the unused strings.)

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
There are better tools to find unused strings.
PSReadline will naturally disappear when I finish integrating the work from this repo into it's own repo and produce a universal module that works with PowerShell Core and Windows PowerShell.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I see coverage data for the files listed originally

title: Code coverage skip some files
